metadata.Title: CVE-2019-11757 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
When following the value's prototype chain, it was possible to retain a reference to a locale, delete it, and subsequently reference it. This resulted in a use-after-free and a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 70, Thunderbird < 68.2, and Firefox ESR < 68.2.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11757` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 70.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 70.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 70.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

thunderbird - 1:68.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:68.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:68.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:68.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:68.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:68.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '70.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mozjs38 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs52 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:68.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
